page.title: 15MEDIA
page.content: { LOCAL NEWS HEADLINE w/e 6/7/85. The main item of news in this week's Aberdare Leader was the attack made on the Cynon Valley Council by the local History Society's Secretary Mr. Mear. The society had set up a temporary museum in the town centre which had proved popular with tourists and locals.The society repeated its demand for a permanent museum.Mr. Mear stated his frustration over the shelving of the society's plans to start a museum. The society feel that a museum would be a major tourist attraction.The Council was,in the opinion of the society,{wasting money on oddities {such as the planned "spiral cycle {way".}
